headline.print_headline: News Guide: Details on Scalia's Health at Time of His Death
headline.main: News Guide: Details on Scalia's Health at Time of His Death

docs.lead_paragraph: Hours after the body of Antonin Scalia was found at a Texas ranch, the Supreme Court justice's doctor offered an assessment of his health to local authorities for their death investigation. A look at some of the details that emerged this week:

headline.main: Big Health Benefits to Small Weight Loss

docs.abstract: Losing as little as 5 percent of your body weight can improve health.
docs.snippet: Losing as little as 5 percent of your body weight can improve health.

headline.main: Student Question | Is Social Media Making Us More Narcissistic?

docs.abstract: Do you spend too much time trying to be attractive and interesting to others? Are you just a little too in love with your own Instagram feed?
docs.snippet: Do you spend too much time trying to be attractive and interesting to others? Are you just a little too in love with your own Instagram feed?

headline.print_headline: Report: Sheriff Was Told He Had No Authority in Scalia Death
headline.main: Report: Sheriff Was Told He Had No Authority in Scalia Death

docs.lead_paragraph: A sheriff's report offers a detailed account of the hours after Antonin Scalia's body was found in Texas, describing how the owner of the luxury resort where the Supreme Court justice died told the sheriff he had no authority in the matter. The report also includes a reference to a pillow that spawned conspiracy theories. A look at the sheriff's account:

headline.print_headline: Nudges Aren’t Enough to Solve Society’s Problems
headline.main: Nudges Aren’t Enough for Problems Like Retirement Savings

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column contends behavorial economics-based nudges like automatically signing up employees for 401(k) plans are not enough to solve retirement savings dearth, let alone cure poverty and other societal problems.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ideas drawn from psychology are helping Americans make better economic choices, but they fail to address problems in areas like retirement savings.
docs.snippet: Ideas drawn from psychology are helping Americans make better economic choices, but they fail to address problems in areas like retirement savings.

keywords.value: Nudge: Improving Decisions About Health, Wealth, and Happiness (Book)

headline.print_headline: APNewsBreak: Scalia Suffered From Many Health Problems
headline.main: APNewsBreak: Scalia Suffered From Many Health Problems

docs.lead_paragraph: Antonin Scalia suffered from coronary artery disease, obesity and diabetes, among other ailments that probably contributed to the justice's sudden death, according to a letter from the Supreme Court's doctor.
docs.snippet: Antonin Scalia suffered from coronary artery disease, obesity and diabetes, among other ailments that probably contributed to the justice's sudden death, according to a letter from the Supreme Court's doctor.

headline.print_headline: Staying Healthy While Trotting the Globe
headline.main: Staying Healthy While Traveling the Globe

docs.abstract: Drink bottled water, take Pepto-Bismol preventively and avoid hungry lions.
docs.snippet: Drink bottled water, take Pepto-Bismol preventively and avoid hungry lions.

headline.print_headline: Wellness App Aims to Improve Nutrition at the Workplace and Beyond
headline.main: Wellness App Aims to Improve Workplace Nutrition

docs.abstract: Start-up Zipongo, with its wellness app and website, helps employees with healthy choices on company cafeteria menus, as well as offering recipes, shopping lists and discounts on groceries; 125 companies are offering Zipongo's tools.
docs.lead_paragraph: Zipongo, a small tech start-up, has connected with 125 companies to help steer employees toward healthier eating.
docs.snippet: Zipongo, a small tech start-up, has connected with 125 companies to help steer employees toward healthier eating.
